column4: Hey people, I want to format every linux partition and install a new one. my question is will the followin work. Deleting Sda4 and everything below it, and second of all, will it hurt my windows 7?
Thats the picture of my partitions
don't even try to delete the files manually, you can seriously screw up your system that way
I am planning on doing it from a live CD
it allows you to format/delete them, so just use that option
not as long as you don't touch the windows7 partition
that is, sda1, sda2 and sda3
last question, will i need 2gb of space to create swap?
one gb will do, I guess
in the worst case? you might be unable to boot windows, but if you have the recovery CDs/DVDs, you can easily recover the MBR with the recoveryshell of windows 7
ubuntu will always ask you to install grub2, every time you install ubuntu, so that'll be fine
yes, but the installer will take care of most things, just make sure that you __DONT__ erase the whole disk, because that obviously also remove windows7
